Package com.mygdx.gigabiteconomy.screens

Class TileManager

java.lang.Object
com.mygdx.gigabiteconomy.screens.TileManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Disposable
public class TileManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Disposable
Class used to hold and manage all Tiles. - Each MySprite instance is passed the TileManager it belongs to and sets a Tile to occupy - Then Player position can be retrieved from the Tile it's on (or the bottom leftmost if multiple -- Rat King)

  • Constructor Details

    • TileManager

      public TileManager​(int sideLength, int maxHeight, int maxWidth, int x, int y)
      Constructor to create a number of tiles for the game screen
      Parameters:
      sideLength - Side length of each tile to create
      maxHeight - Height to fill with tiles (usually texture height)
      maxWidth - Width to fill with tiles (usually texture width)
      x - Position of first tile on screen (bottom left)
      y - Position of first tile on screen (bottom left)

  • Method Details

    • getAdjacentTile

      public Tile getAdjacentTile​(Tile tileFrom, MovingSprite.DIRECTION direction, int distance)
      Get certain in a direction "distance" from given Tile, not strictly adjacent but doesn't matter :p
      Parameters:
      tileFrom - Tile from which to calculate distance from
      direction - Direction to retrieve the next tile in
      distance - Distance from Tile given to get new Tile
      Returns:
      Tile satisfying conditions, or null if impossible

    • placeObject

      public java.util.ArrayList<Tile> placeObject​(TiledObject to, java.util.ArrayList<Tile> toPlace)
      Method to place an object on a group of Tiles. Modifies rowArray accordingly
      Parameters:
      to - TiledObject to place
      toPlace - ArrayList of Tiles to place on
      Returns:
      toPlace

    • getTiles

      public java.util.ArrayList<Tile> getTiles​(int x, int y, int width, int height)
      Returns ArrayList of unoccupied tiles between coordinates given
      Parameters:
      x - bottom left coord of where to start
      y - bottom left coord of where to start
      width - of tile segment to return
      height - of tile segment to return
      Returns:
      ArrayList of requested tiles

    • getSelectiveDir

      public java.util.ArrayList<Tile> getSelectiveDir​(int x, int y, MovingSprite.DIRECTION direction)
      Parameters:
      x - coordinate to find row of
      y - coordinate to find row of
      direction - which direction to return row of
      Returns:

    • findDirectionFrom

      public MovingSprite.DIRECTION findDirectionFrom​(Tile curr, Tile next)
      Parameters:
      curr - Tile to search from
      next - Tile to search for
      Returns:
      MovingSprite.DIRECTION of next from curr. E.g. Which direction is Player relative to Enemy?

    • getAdjacentTiles

      public Tile[] getAdjacentTiles​(Tile tile)
      Method to get list of adjacent tiles to given Tile
      Returns:
      Tile[4] of Tiles clockwise from given Tile starting with Northern-most

      tiles -
      Returns:

    • getNextTiles

      public java.util.ArrayList<Tile> getNextTiles​(MovingSprite mo, MovingSprite.DIRECTION dirIn, int distance)
      Method to get group of next tiles to move to
      Parameters:
      mo - MovingSprite on which to act on
      dirIn - Direction to move MovingSprite in
      distance - How much are we moving by? (Usually 1)
      Returns:
      ArrayList of tiles to move to

    • withinTileBounds

      public boolean withinTileBounds​(MovingSprite mo, java.util.ArrayList<Tile> toCheck)
      Method to check whether passed MovingSprite is within the bounds of a group of Tiles
      Parameters:
      mo - MovingSprite to check
      toCheck - ArrayList of Tiles to check bounds of
      Returns:
      True: Yes, within bounds ; False: No

    • dispose

      public void dispose()
      Remove all sprites in the Tile Manager from memory. To be called when the associated level ends/completes.
      Specified by:
      dispose in interface com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Disposable
